resources.string:
She went to the cobbler’s 
To buy him some shoes, 
But when she came back 
He was reading the news.
Mother Goose\'s nursery rhymes \nPublisher: London, New York: George Routledge and Sons, 1877

Application created by Greta Grigutė as part of Google developer Android Basics Nanodegree, 6th project. 

Pictures: 

 Illustrations used for "no internet" and "no stories" images from https://www.oldbookillustrations.com/illustrations 

 Photo in Drawer heading (modified - cropped) by Samuel Zeller on https://unsplash.com 

 Photo used when no images available (modified - cropped, added text "no images available") - by Florian Klauer on https://unsplash.com 

News source: https://open-platform.theguardian.com, https://www.theguardian.com 

Icons: https://material.io/icons 

Custom ripple effect solution: 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30931889/adding-ripple-effect-to-recyclerview-item/30933094#30933094 
and to be able to apply it on card view: https://stackoverflow.com/a/28041873/5770629 

Coordinator layout learning sources: 
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/design/widget/CoordinatorLayout.html 
http://saulmm.github.io/mastering-coordinator https://lab.getbase.com/introduction-to-coordinator-layout-on-android 

Recycler view learning sources: 
http://www.vogella.com/tutorials/AndroidRecyclerView/article.html 
https://www.androidhive.info/2016/01/android-working-with-recycler-view
Settings will be added in Project Stage 2.
